attributes.action: Stop money being sent abroad when Britain's flooding, roads and railways and infrastructure all need attention
attributes.additional_details: We call upon the Government to stop sending money abroad such as Foreign Aid at a cost of £8.66 Billion pounds per year and reduce the amount sent to the European Community costing an estimed 40 million pounds per day when Britain is in crisis and needs Britsh tax payers money to be spent in Britain instead. This should be used for example on road repairs (pot holes and surfacing), railway repairs and defences against flooding and increase areas infrastructures where hosuing deveopment has increased and local infrastructure is unable to cope with the influx of additional people.
